questions.text:
Please complete this line from their 1966 hit song "Good Lovin": 
"I said doctor, Mr. M.D. /  Now can you tell me what's __________me?"
questions.explanation:
ailing.

	"Good Lovin" was the Young Rascals' first number one single in the USA. It was one of the the last songs that was not written by the team of Felix Cavaliere and Eddie Brigati. The lyrics to the song read, "Doctor, Mr. M.D. / Now can you tell me what's ailing me?" When music critics heard the song, they immediately dubbed the style "blue-eyed soul." The members of the Rascals were not exactly thrilled with the term, since none of them had blue eyes.

questions.text: The third verse of the their 1967 hit single " Lonely Too Long" begins with the line, "Now look at me..." What is the singer doing "through this world of beauty"?
questions.explanation:
gliding.

	After the initial success of "Good Lovin", the Young Rascals did not fare very well in the USA with their next couple of singles. However, "Lonely Too Long" gave the group their second top 20 single in the States; it peaked at number 16 in January 1967. The lyrics read: "Now look at me / Gliding through this world of beauty / Everything I do brings ecstasy, oh yeah!"

questions.text: Who was the lead singer on the Young Rascals' 1967 smash hit "Groovin"?
questions.explanation:
Felix Cavaliere.

	Felix Cavaliere played the keyboards and also did lead and background vocals for the Rascals. He gave a jazzy, soulful style to the song "Groovin." Eddie Brigati did backgound vocals on "Groovin" and was the lead vocalist for many of the group's other hits. Gene Cornish was the Rascals' guitarist, and Dino Danelli played drums for the band.

questions.text: According to the lyrics of The Young Rascals' 1967 song "Groovin", when is a perfect time to relax?
questions.explanation:
Sunday afternoon.

	"Groovin" became an international monster hit for the Rascals in the spring and summer of 1967. Its lyrics said, "Groovin' on a Sunday afternoon / Really couldn't get away too soon..." The song is perfect for relaxing in the summertime. "Groovin'" was later recorded by such artists as Aretha Franklin and Marvin Gaye.

questions.text: Which 1967 song by the Rascals features the lyrics, "When you are happy / Every place feels like home 'cause you're never alone"?
questions.explanation:
It's Wonderful.

	The song "It's Wonderful" was included on the Rascals' 1968 album "Once Upon A Dream." The album reached the number nine spot in the U.S. charts. The single was released before the album came out, and the song climbed to the number 20 position on the Billboard charts in December 1967. The lyrics read: "Every place feels like home 'cause you're never alone / There's much to be said when it's all in your head..." "You Better Run", "Come On Up" and "Love Is a Beautiful Thing" were songs which appeared on the 1968 album "Time Peace: Greatest Hits."

questions.text: According to the bridge section of the band's 1967 hit "A Girl Like You", what feeling does the singer have "every time I'm holding you close to me"?
questions.explanation:
ecstasy.

	"A Girl Like You" was the Young Rascals' followup single to "Groovin." Although this song wasn't nearly as successful as "Groovin", it managed to reach the number ten position on the Billboard charts in August 1967. The lyrics read, "Every time I'm holding you close to me / Trouble's gone, it's gone, I'm in ecstasy..."

questions.text: The second verse of the band's 1967 ballad "How Can I Be Sure" begins with the line "Whenever I, whenever I am away from you..." Which one of these words is contained in the lyrics of that second verse?
questions.explanation:
alibi.

	"How Can I Be Sure" showcased Eddie Brigati's soaring vocals. The song reached the number four position on the Billboard charts in September 1967. The lyrics to the second verse read: "Whenever I, whenever I am away from you / My alibi is telling people I don't care for you / Maybe I'm just hanging around with my head up, upside down / It's a pity I can't seem to find someone who's as pretty and lovely as you..."

questions.text: According to the bridge section of the Rascals' 1968 hit song "A Beautiful Morning", which type of bird will be found "with children...and flowers"?
questions.explanation:
robins.

	"A Beautiful Morning" was released in the spring of 1968, and the music and lyrics were perfect for a sunny spring day. The Rascals sang, "There will be children with robins and flowers / Sunshine caresses each new waking hour." The song climbed to the number three spot on the Billboard charts in May/June 1968.

questions.text: According to the first verse of their 1968 smash hit "People Got to Be Free", where should there be "peace"?
questions.explanation:
in the valley.

	The song "People Got to be Free" begins with the verse, "All the world over, so easy to see / People everywhere just wanna be free / Listen, please listen, that's the way it should be / Peace in the valley, people got to be free." This song was a major hit single in the summer of 1968; it stayed at the top of the Billboard charts for several weeks.

questions.text: Which member of The Rascals was born in Canada?
questions.explanation:
Gene Cornish.

	Gene Cornish was born in Ottawa, Canada, in 1946. Brigati and Danelli were born in New Jersey; Cavaliere was born in New York State. The Rascals achieved their greatest commercial success in Canada, topping the singles charts on six different occasions in that nation. The Rascals were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2005.
